titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2389) to amend title 28, United States Code, with respect to the jurisdiction of Federal courts over certain cases and controversies involving the Pledge of Allegiance.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2389) to amend title 28, United States Code, with respect to the jurisdiction of Federal courts over certain cases and controversies involving the Pledge of Allegiance.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-577, by Mr. Gingrey.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2389 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 214.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 920.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 200 (Roll no. 382).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 168 (Roll no. 383).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2389 (Pledge Protection Act of 2005).
